# RMarkdown

> Is amazing.

## What can RMarkdown be used for?

1. [HTML Reports](https://bookdown.org/yihui/rmarkdown/html-document.html) & [PDF Reports](https://bookdown.org/yihui/rmarkdown/pdf-document.html)
2. [HTML Slide Decks](https://bookdown.org/yihui/rmarkdown/ioslides-presentation.html) & [PowerPoint](https://bookdown.org/yihui/rmarkdown/powerpoint-presentation.html)
3. [Interactive Dashboards](https://rmarkdown.rstudio.com/flexdashboard/index.html)
4. [Books with `bookdown`](https://bookdown.org/)
5. [Websites with `blogdown`](https://bookdown.org/yihui/blogdown/)

## Key Resources

- [RMarkdown Website with Gallery](https://rmarkdown.rstudio.com/index.html)

- Key Reference: [RMarkdown - The Definitive Guide](https://bookdown.org/yihui/rmarkdown/)

- PDF Printing Setup: [tinytex](https://yihui.name/tinytex/)


::: {.cell layout-align="center" hash='reporting_rmarkdown_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_891d4ab3cb988f1ba36c79b4061757ca'}

```{.r .cell-code}
# PDF Knitting Setup: https://yihui.name/tinytex/ 
# install.packages("tintex")
# tinytex::install_tinytex()
```
:::



# How Rmarkdown Works

# Header 1

## Header 2

### Header 3

# Working with Text

Free-form text.

Make text __bold__.

Make text _italics_.

Make text ___bold + italics___.

Talk about code - the `tidyverse` is awesome

__Unordered List:__

- Item 1

- Item 2

__Ordered List:__

1. First point

2. Second point

3. More points

# Images

::: {.cell layout-align="center" hash='reporting_rmarkdown_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-3_4d8f2bf9a778a9c19ed9e8474e19c700'}

# Code 

Read in data and print to HTML. Notice effect of `df_print: paged` option for HTML. 

- Try changing to `df_print: default`, or `kable` or `tibble`. PDF prints normally.

- Try changing `results = "hide"`.


::: {.cell layout-align="center" hash='reporting_rmarkdown_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-4_6c2c16caf738b3c92811cb273480efd9'}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Bike data
bikes_tbl      <- readRDS("01_data/bikes_tbl.rds")
bikeshops_tbl  <- readRDS("01_data/bikeshops_tbl.rds")
orderlines_tbl <- readRDS("01_data/orderlines_tbl.rds")

bike_orderlines_tbl <- orderlines_tbl %>%
    left_join(bikes_tbl,     by = c("product_id" = "bike_id")) %>%
    left_join(bikeshops_tbl, by = c("customer_id" = "bikeshop_id")) %>%
    mutate(total_price = price_euro * quantity)

bike_orderlines_tbl
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 15,644 × 23
   order_id order_line order_date          customer_id product_id quantity model
      <dbl>      <dbl> <dttm>                    <dbl>      <dbl>    <dbl> <chr>
 1        1          1 2015-01-07 00:00:00           2       2681        1 Spec…
 2        1          2 2015-01-07 00:00:00           2       2411        1 Ulti…
 3        2          1 2015-01-10 00:00:00          10       2629        1 Neur…
 4        2          2 2015-01-10 00:00:00          10       2137        1 Spee…
 5        3          1 2015-01-10 00:00:00           6       2367        1 Stit…
 6        3          2 2015-01-10 00:00:00           6       1973        1 Road…
 7        3          3 2015-01-10 00:00:00           6       2422        1 Spee…

 9        3          5 2015-01-10 00:00:00           6       2247        1 Torq…
10        4          1 2015-01-11 00:00:00          22       2408        1 Ulti…
# ℹ 15,634 more rows
# ℹ 16 more variables: year <dbl>, frame_material <chr>, weight <dbl>,
#   price_euro <dbl>, category_1 <chr>, category_2 <chr>, category_3 <chr>,
#   gender <chr>, description <chr>, url <chr>, name <chr>, city <chr>,
#   state <chr>, lat <dbl>, lng <dbl>, total_price <dbl>
```
:::
:::


We can do data manipulations too. Try changing the YAML `code_folding` option from `none` to `hide` to `show`.


::: {.cell layout-align="center" hash='reporting_rmarkdown_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-5_c544b42c83b94989defb70caa91320bd'}

```{.r .cell-code}
sales_by_category_tbl <- bike_orderlines_tbl %>%
  dplyr::select(category_2, category_1, total_price) %>%
  
  group_by(category_2, category_1) %>%
  summarise(total_revenue = sum(total_price)) %>%
  ungroup() %>%
  
  arrange(desc(total_revenue)) %>%
  mutate(category_2 = as_factor(category_2) %>% fct_rev())
```
:::



# Plots

Plotting works as expected. Try changin:

- `out.height`, `out.width` and Knitting

- Potential gotcha - Interactive plots (e.g. `plotly`) will not display in PDF

__Static Plots:__ 

- Use `ggplot2`.


::: {.cell layout-align="center" hash='reporting_rmarkdown_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-6_7c7bbccefddfcd3c80f389c43d0019e3'}

```{.r .cell-code}
g <- sales_by_category_tbl %>%
  ggplot(aes(category_2, total_revenue, fill = category_1)) +
  
  # Geoms
  geom_col() +
  coord_flip() +
  
  # Formatting
  labs(
    title = "Total Revenue by Category",
    x = "", y = "", fill = ""
  )

g
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![Revenue by Category](reporting_rmarkdown_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-6-1.png){fig-align='center' width=2100 height=600px}
:::
:::


__Interactive plots:__ 

- Use `ggplotly()`.


::: {.cell layout-align="center" hash='reporting_rmarkdown_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-7_21afeacf16948371edf83cb0013ac362'}

```{.r .cell-code}
# ggplotly(g)
```
:::



# Tables

__Static Tables:__

- `knitr` package - `knitr::kable()` - Simple to use, great with PDF
- [`gt` package](https://gt.rstudio.com/) - Really good for static tables


::: {.cell layout-align="center" hash='reporting_rmarkdown_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-8_00684c52f53966cd595eba504cd31453'}

```{.r .cell-code}
table_formatted_tbl <- sales_by_category_tbl %>%
  rename_all(.funs = ~ str_replace(., "_", " ") %>%
               str_to_title()) 

table_formatted_tbl %>% knitr::kable()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}

__Dynamic Tables:__

- Can print tables without additional formatting in HTML with the `df_print: paged` option in YAML
- Potential Gotcha: Note that this will not print with format in PDF


::: {.cell layout-align="center" hash='reporting_rmarkdown_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-9_61e500f515904186e9080ebfe6845759'}

```{.r .cell-code}
table_formatted_tbl
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
